casebody.data:
Christopher WESTMORELAND, et al., Appellants,
v.
Robert A. BOSWORTH, et al., Respondents. No. ED 106243 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION THREE. Filed: September 4, 2018 Christopher Westmoreland, 129 Timka Drive, Ballwin, Missouri 63011, Pro Se. FOR RESPONDENTS: Bruce D. Lemoine, Christopher R. Larose, Andrew S. Zimmerman, 7700 Forsyth Boulevard, Suite 1800, Clayton, Missouri 63105, David M. Dare, 439 S. Kirkwood Road, Suite 204, St. Louis, Missouri 63122, Jamie Lea Thompson, Paul L. Brusati, 7701 Forsyth Boulevard, Suite 400, Clayton, Missouri 63105, Dennis L. Callahan, 2458 Old Dorsett Road, Suite 230, Maryland Heights, Missouri 63043. Before Sherri B. Sullivan, P.J., Lawrence E. Mooney, J., and James M. Dowd, J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM

Christopher Westmoreland, et al. appeal the trial court's dismissal with prejudice of their petition alleging that in a prior collections action, Respondents engaged in self-dealing, misappropriated Appellants' funds, or were negligent.

We find that no error of law appears, and that an extended opinion would have no precedential value. Therefore, we affirm and dispose of this case by written order pursuant to Rule 84.16(b).
